intro: Erysimum hirschfeldioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
